episodes.overview: The Shinsengumi and the Yorozuya attend the funeral of a close udon shop owner. Instead of moving on, however, the soul of the old man is overseeing the ceremony.

episodes.name: The People You Tend to Forget Tend to Show Up After You Forget Them
episodes.overview: Katsura visit Yorozuya with a Elizabeth's placard to solve the mystery of Elizabeth's disappearance. But the investigation only reveals a shocking truth.

episodes.name: The Legendary Mercenary Tribe, Renho.  Elizabeth Was in Fact, One of Those White Demons
episodes.overview: The Yorozuya and Katsura follow Elizabeth to stop the Renho from taking over the earth.

episodes.name: Piggy Banks and Trash Cans
episodes.overview: The Yorozuya, Katsura, and Sakamoto disguise themselves as Renho and infiltrate their base.

episodes.name: Empty Planet
episodes.overview: Elizabeth and Dark Vader battle to the death and just when things are not looking so good for Elizabeth, Katsura shows up to save his friend.

episodes.name: Goodbye Lionel, Why Don't You Say Something!
episodes.overview: The Renho join forces with Sakamoto and the Yorozuya against Dark Vader and their home planet in order to bring peace to the universe.

episodes.name: Please Take Me Skiing
episodes.overview: The Shinsengumi are forced to guard the Shogun on his first snowboarding trip, but they run into the Yorozuya and mayhem ensues.

episodes.name: A Vacation in Disorientation
episodes.overview: Everybody's stranded in the middle of the mountains. To make things worse, the Shogun goes missing.

episodes.name: There are Some Things You Should Not Forget When Drinking away the Past Year at Year-end Parties
episodes.overview: It's a year-end party at Odd Jobs! The Gintama anime has been through a lot, but Gintoki tells Kagura and Shinpachi to keep it cool. And then the usual members join in for some real partying... The next morning, Gintoki wakes up to discover that he's made some very bad mistakes.

episodes.name: People Can Only Live By Forgetting the Bad
episodes.overview: After getting drunk at the year-end party, Gintoki managed to become a six-timer in one night. In order to prevent the show from being pulled off the air, Gintoki is forced into engaging in a relationship with all of them. And now he has to go on dates with all of them at the same time...

episodes.name: We Are All Hosts, In Capital Letters
episodes.overview: The number one host in the Kabuki district, Kyoshiro, summons the Odd Jobs members to his club, Takamagahara, and tells them that he intends to quit because of a lady named Madame Yagami who controls the night world. It seems that she declared she would be making a second visit to Takamagahara, which is essentially a death sentence. The hosts at Kyoshiro's have quit out of fear, so Gintoki and co must find hosts to handle the Madame...

episodes.name: Girls like Vegeta, Guys like Piccolo
episodes.overview: The Madame's arrival is imminent. Kyoshiro, Gintoki, and friends attempt to scout some help, but they end up with a bunch of oddballs. And it turns out that Otae has invited guests from all over town who go wild and leave the bar and Kyoshiro broken! There's no time to worry about taking care of customers.

episodes.name: Draw Your Life on the Canvas We Call Manga
episodes.overview: Jellybeans Vanguard Honda is on his fifth year as a Jump editor. However, he's been assigned to the manga Gintaman, which has driven multiple editors insane. In order to save himself, Honda must find a new talented artist so he can be reassigned. One day, he is visited by an aspiring manga artist by the name of N3016.

episodes.name: Check It Out!
episodes.overview: The Sasaki family is as elite as it gets, and one of its members, Tetsunosuke, has joined the Shinsengumi. He would have joined the Mimawarigumi, a police force with pedigree, but he is considered a troublemaker, which is why he was sent to the Shinsengumi. Kondo assigns Tetsu to Hijikata as an assistant, so Hijikata is forced to endure the new recruit...

episodes.name: Thorny and Rosy
episodes.overview: Tetsunosuke has completely changed as he sincerely tries to perform his new job. Isaburo despises Tetsunosuke and tells Hijikata that he should dispose of him, but Hijikata, who came from a similar background, sympathizes with Tetsunosuke and looks after him. Meanwhile, Gintoki, who was arrested by the Mimawarigumi, has been assigned a mission by Isaburo...

episodes.name: Festival of Thornies
episodes.overview: Tetsunosuke has been ordered to deliver a letter for Hijikata. However, he's captured by the radical Joi Check It Out gang in the process. Tetsunosuke had concealed his identity to join the gang, but now they know that he has connections to the police. He's taken hostage as leverage over the Shinsengumi and Mimawarigumi. However, the Mimawarigumi shows no concern for the hostage and plots to place the blame squarely on the Shinsengumi. Hijikata and the other members are enraged after learning Isaburo's plans. The Shinsengumi and Mimawarigumi are now in an all-out fight.

episodes.name: Letter From Thorny
episodes.overview: The Shinsengumi attempt to save Tetsunosuke from the Check It Out gang, but the Mimawarigumi stands in the way. Neither side is willing to back down, but Gintoki, who had infiltrated the gang as a Mimawarigumi spy, manages to save Tetsunosuke! Kondo orders the Shinsengumi to begin fighting back!

episodes.name: Madaodog Madaonaire
episodes.overview: The middle-aged dumb-ass oldie, or Madao, Taizo Hasegawa finds himself on a game show with a chance to win ten million yen. Will he be able to endure the pressure and become a Madaonaire!? And what is Madao's motivation for participating in the game show...?

episodes.name: Presents Are Meant To Be Given Early
episodes.overview: A character from 2 years ago is back with a request for Gin. This favor will take the Odd-Job Trio right in the middle of Satan Festival in this very special Christmas episode.

episodes.name: New Year's Envelopes Are Perfect for Dirty Jokes
episodes.overview: Gin is trying to hand out New Year Envelopes but the lack of children characters make it hard. To make matters worse, everyone seems to have their mind wrapped around long cylindrical objects and small spherical objects.

episodes.name: When Sleeping Under a Kotatsu, Make Sure You Don't Burn Your Balls
episodes.overview: Nobody cares anymore, the animators, producers, not even Hideaki Sorachi. Aww, it’s such a drag even the characters are airing their grievances. Where do we go from here?

episodes.name: We're Sorry
episodes.overview: Its last episode and Gintama' is going out with a bang. A Gintama clip show!

episodes.name: Nobody with Natural Straight Hair Can Be That Bad
episodes.overview: Gintoki returns from a six-month vacation to find he has been replaced by a gold-haired imposter.

episodes.name: Kintoki and Gintoki
episodes.overview: Tama reveals Kintoki's origins and hatches a plan with Gintoki and Sadaharu to make the town remember the real Odd Jobs leader.

episodes.name: Kin-san's Kintama
episodes.overview: After Gintoki saves Tama from Kintoki, he finds the whole town turned against him after Kintoki frames him for the attack! Now Gintoki must face not only Kintoki, but all his former friends too! However, some of them are beginning to have doubts.

episodes.name: The Meaning of a Main Character
episodes.overview: It's time for the final showdown. Gintoki's friends rally around him once more, but Kintoki still has one more trick up his sleeve that could spell the end of Gintama forever!

episodes.name: Courtesan Turns the Tables
episodes.overview: Many years ago, the famous courtesan Suzuran made a promise with one of her clients. She has waiting in Yoshiwara ever since, hoping meet this man again. Many years have passed and Suzuran is now old and on her deathbed. Gintoki and Tsukuyo decide to track down this man, but are shocked when they find out just who he is.

episodes.name: Inside the Palace!!
episodes.overview: Whilst trying to hide the unconscious Shogun, Gintoki and the gang encounter his uncle, the former Shogun, the man who allegedly made the promise with Suzuran. However, when Tsukuyo asks about her, they discover something that could spell danger for them all.

episodes.name: Five Pinkies
episodes.overview: Gintoki and the gang storm the palace looking for Maizo and Sadasada, the former Shogun. They find and confront Sadasada, but he still has a few tricks up his sleeve...

episodes.name: Pinky Swear
episodes.overview: Just when it looks like all is lost, the Shinsengumi and Mimawarigumi arrive to lend their aid to our heroes. Sadasada attempts to escape but Gintoki is hot in pursuit.

episodes.name: Unsetting Moon
episodes.overview: As the Tendoshu arrive to take control of the situation, Shigeshige makes an unexpected announcement.

episodes.name: The Sound of a Beam Can Pierce Every Heart
episodes.overview: Otae has decided that it's finally time to re-open the dojo to new students. Shortly after deciding this, she and Shinpachi meet with an unexpected acquaintance from the past. His name is Hajime, a former student of the dojo who was missing, assumed dead after being caught in an explosion in the terminal. Now that he has returned, he will help them revive the dojo, however there is something different about him.

episodes.name: Two Brothers
episodes.overview: Hajime's secret is revealed and the fate of the world hangs in the balance. Gintoki, seemingly ignoring Otae's pleas, decides to settle the score with Hajime himself.

episodes.name: Liquor and Gasoline, Smiles and Tears
episodes.overview: Shinpachi arrives and saves Gintoki at the last moment. Although Gintoki was trying to save Hajime, Shinpachi and Otae have now resolved to put an end to this no matter what.

episodes.name: Dog Food Doesn't Taste Like You Think
episodes.overview: Sadaharu, fed up with the lack of food at Odd Jobs, decides to leave to fend for himself. On the way he meets a starving puppy that he can't ignore.

episodes.name: You Can Never Pause at the Perfect Time
episodes.overview: Gin finds a strange clock and accidentally breaks it, causing all time in the universe to come to a stop.

episodes.name: Even a Matsui Stick Can't Handle Some Kinds of Dirt
episodes.overview: Odd Jobs continue to try and fix the Universal Clock, with little success.

episodes.name: An Inspector's Love Begins With an Inspection
episodes.overview: Yamazaki is on the verge of breaking down after staking out Odd Jobs' place for days on end. Tama offers some words of encouragement at just the right moment. Unfortunately, Yamazaki's new found affection for Tama soon turns into full-blown stalking. Concerned, the Shinsengumi send Okita to help fix things...

episodes.name: Forget Dates, Remember People / You Can Hide Your Porn Mags, But You Can't Hide Your ***
episodes.overview:
Part 1 - Tsukuyo attempts to give Seita history lessons, but he refuses to take it seriously. Gintoki attempts to help, but his version of events may not be very accurate.

Part 2 - Shinpachi runs into Gintoki whilst attempting to smuggle "Ho Love-ru" manga. The pair discuss how best to hide them from his sister.

episodes.name: A Mirror Provides a Frozen Reflection of Both Your Beautiful and Ugly Sides / Nobody Likes the Photo on Their License
episodes.overview:
Part 1 - Sacchan finds a new stalking spot in Odd Job's building, but witnesses some unexpected things as the gang go about their morning rituals!

Part 2 - Yamazaki is fed up with being labelled as boring at work and tries to get a ninja license.

episodes.name: Arriving Late to a Reunion Makes it Hard to Enter
episodes.overview: Gin is tricked into turning up to a reunion party with Katsura and Sakamoto. The two are unhappy with their lack of screen time and are determined to start a flashback arc, but they then get sidetracked trying to figure out the identity of a supposed fifth hero who supported them from the sidelines.

episodes.name: A Reunion Also Brings to the Surface Things You Don't Want to Remember
episodes.overview: Gin and co finally remember the phantom fifth member, Kurokono Tasuke. They also remember blowing him up by accident! Could it be that this reunion was arranged by Kurokono's vengeful spirit?

episodes.name: When Compared to Time in the Heavens, Fifty Years of Human Life Resembles Naught but Dreams and Lottery Tickets
episodes.overview: Whilst buying his cigarettes, Hijikata is persuaded to take a lottery ticket someone left behind. Against all the odds, it's the jackpot winner! Hijikata becomes paranoid that somebody knows he has the ticket and then bumps into the last person he wants to see!

episodes.name: Guys With Big Nostrils Also Have Big Imaginations / You Never Accept a New Sentai Series at the Start, But By the Final Episode, You Don't Want It to End
episodes.overview:
Part 1 - Odd Jobs discuss ways to advertise themselves to attract new customers.

Part 2 - Now that the previous four Devas have retired, the new leaders try to think of ways to make the Kabuki District less intimidating after being ranked the "least desirable place to live".

episodes.name: 9 + 1 = Yagyu Jyubei
episodes.overview: Chaos ensues in the Kabuki district after a fanatical cult swaps everyone's genders around.

episodes.name: Calories Come Back to Bite You Just When You've Forgotten About Them
episodes.overview: Odd Jobs and the Shinsengumi (F) team up to overthrow the cult, but Kyubei starts to question whether he/she wants to turn back into a woman.
The gang break into the cult's headquarters but the leaders have already escaped. Faced with the possibility of never changing back, everyone must now adjust to their new genders.

episodes.name: All Mothers Pack Too Much Food Into a Lunch Box and Ruin the Shape
episodes.overview: Concerned that Seita doesn't seem to be making friends at temple school, Hinowa and Tsukuyo, believing the problem to lie with his lunch box, attempt to fix the problem but only seem to make it worse.

episodes.name: The Reaper by Day and the Reaper by Night
episodes.overview: Recently, there has been a bizarre string of murders around town. The victims have all been killed the same way, with their heads virtually severed, bar a small strand of flesh. Gintoki, whilst stumbling home drunk, encounters what appears to be a reaper who asks him to help with their ritual suicide. He will soon discover just how the two are related.

episodes.name: Human or Demon?
episodes.overview: After revealing that his name was among the criminals sentenced to be executed, Yaemon blackmails Gin into smuggling Asaemon to safety. Meanwhile, Hijikata and Okita follow up their own leads on the reaper, uncovering a greater conspiracy in the process.

episodes.name: Farewell, Reaper
episodes.overview: Asaemon confronts Yaemon, but after he reveals that it was Gintoki who was the reason for her father's death, her resolve waivers. Will her blade strike Yaemon or Gintoki?

episodes.name: A Phoenix Rises from the Ashes  Over and Over
episodes.overview: Hasegawa come to Odd Jobs looking for new ghost stories to scare kids in the park. Unfortunately, the scariest thing about these stories might be the copyright laws they're breaking!

episodes.name: Amen
episodes.overview: Gintoki notices that many drunken patrons of Otose's bar are confessing their sins to Tama and decides to take advantage of that by opening a confessional and taking a cut of the fees. Many of the confessions seem to mention a certain worthless boss who sounds very familiar!

episodes.name: Being a Leader is Tough
episodes.overview: After the previous episode's escapades, Katsura finds the unconscious Shigeshige and takes him back to the Joi Rebels hideout. Shigeshige has lost his memories of being the Shogun, but everyone but Katsura recognizes him straight away! Katsura, seeing potential in Shigeshige as a natural-born leader, attempts to teach him the qualities of leadership, but ends up being one-upped by him!

episodes.name: Love is a Roach Motel
episodes.overview: After inviting Otae to the festival and being rejected, Kondo rampages around, taking his frustrations out on happy couples there. In an effort to hide the fact that the one making the scene is the Shinsengumi chief, Sougo and Hijikata convince him to wear a disguise. A short while later, Kondo runs into Otae, who doesn't seem to recognize him in his cockroach mask.

episodes.name: A Sizzle Summer / A Nothing Summer 2015
episodes.overview:
Part 1 - After being told by Gin and Shinpachi that part of the joy of eating watermelons is the "drama" that comes with them, Kagura and Princess Soyo decide to raise the stakes.

Part 2 - Summer break is almost over and Seita has not done his homework! He goes to Odd Jobs for help but as usual gets more than he bargained for!

episodes.name: He's the Sweet Tooth, and I'm the Mayo Guy
episodes.overview: After getting hit by a truck, Gin and Hijikata mysteriously switch bodies. Now they must adapt to living each other's lives while trying to find a way to switch back.

episodes.name: I'm a Failure as a Leader, and He's Also a Failure as a Leader
episodes.overview: Gin and Hijikata find Gengai, who's newest invention is responsible for their body swapping. He tries to reverse the process but it doesn't work as something is missing. Gin remembers that part of his soul ended up in a dead cat which they must now find. Unfortunately, the Shinsengumi, with their new found freedom, and Odd Jobs, with their new strict codes, seem intent on getting in their way.

episodes.name: I'm Odd Jobs, and He's Shinsengumi
episodes.overview: Gin and Hijikata manage to track down the cat with part of Gin's soul in it, which is being looked after by Otae. Attempts to capture it are complicated when the rest of the gang turn up and have also swapped bodies!

episodes.name: Always Leave Enough Room for Fifty Million in Your Bag
episodes.overview: Mutsu recalls to Gin how she and Sakamoto first became acquainted.

episodes.name: Always Leave Enough Room for Pebbles in Your Bag
episodes.overview: Sakamoto has been kidnapped by the pirates they double-crossed in the past! Now, it's up to Mutsu and Gin to rescue him.

episodes.name: Style Goes Out of Fashion the Moment It's Put Into Words / There Are Two Types of People In This World: Those Who Yell Out Their Attack Names, and Those Who Don't
episodes.overview:
Part 1 - The Odd Jobs trio try out different outfits and styles, with disastrous consequences. 

Part 2 - Facing a disinterested group of old bums at their Dojo, Shinpachi asks the others for help in motivating them. They discover a scroll left behind by his dad containing a secret ultimate move.

episodes.name: The Two Apes
episodes.overview: Whilst out "patrolling" Tae's house, Kondo encounters a notorious thief known as Ape Boy. Sensing his Gorilla-like strength and agility, Ape Boy asks Kondo to become his disciple.

episodes.name: Afros of Life and Death
episodes.overview: Katsura attempts to infiltrate the Shinsengumi wearing an afro as a disguise. He gets more than he bargained for when he is assigned to the squad of another Afro-wearer with some serious social issues!

episodes.name: Afuro and Wolfro
episodes.overview: Zura, having successfully infiltrated the Shinsengumi, now attempts to get rid of Wolfro, deeming him a threat.

episodes.name: Take the Initial Premise Lightly, and It'll Cost You
episodes.overview: Whilst on a job tailing someone in the blistering summer heat, Gin steals Kagura's parasol, forgetting that the Yato are weak against sunlight. Kagura falls ill and is taken to the hospital.

episodes.name: Keep Your Farewells Short
episodes.overview: Kagura's ruse has gone too far! After faking her illness things take a turn for the worse as everyone assumes she is dying. Even Soyo turns up and ends up planning a state funeral for her. It looks like it's too late for Kagura to correct the misunderstanding now!

episodes.name: One Editor Is Enough / The G-Pen Is Capricious and the Maru Pen Is Stubborn
episodes.overview:
Part 1 - After faking a stomachache to work on his Manga in peace in the infirmary, Shachi's work is discovered by the nurse there, who likes it a lot! Shachi wants to try asking her out but doesn't know how to. Gin suggests he do it through his Manga.

Part 2 - Gin and Shachi finally get a chance to debut in Jump, however they only have one night to finish their manuscript! Gin finds some assistants to help. Will they finish in time?

episodes.name: Strike When the Sword and Overlord are Hot / Oil Rain
episodes.overview:
Part 1 - Tetsuko leaves Odd Jobs in charge of her store while she looks for rare materials. It doesn't take long before some strange characters appear asking for various legendary swords to be fixed.

Part 2 - Tama befriends an cigarette vending machine that has become unreliable due to its age. Over time, the two become closer, but their happy days may be numbered.

episodes.name: Shoguns of Light and Shadow
episodes.overview: After the Shogun nearly falls victim to an assassination attempt by unknown forces, a plan is put into motion to help him escape Edo. Several diversions, each with body doubles set off in different directions, guarded by those loyal to Shigeshige. However the loyalty of some remains uncertain...

episodes.name: Ninja Village
episodes.overview: Zenzou and the Iga clan have betrayed the Shogun! Their forces are ambushed from all sides as forces loyal to the shogun desperately fight back.

episodes.name: Ninja Soul
episodes.overview: After it becomes clear that the Iga clan didn't actually betray the Shogun, Gin and co are taken to their village and learn the truth about the Shogun's deep involvement with the clan in the past.

episodes.name: And Then There Were Five
episodes.overview: As Sarutobi attempts to rescue the critically wounded Zenzou, Odd Jobs, Hijikata and Kondou desparately fight back against the ruthless Yato clan, trying to get the Shogun to safety. Meanwhile, Takasugi seeks out Gintoki to end things once and for all.

episodes.name: Those Who Protect Against All Odds
episodes.overview: Past histories are finally confronted for Gintoki and Kagura as they face off against Takasugi and Kamui.

episodes.name: Sworn Enemy
episodes.overview: As Gintoki and Takasugi continue their frenzied fight, the past they shared together with Katsura is revealed, as well as the fate of their teacher, Shouyou.

episodes.name: The Crows Caw After the Battle Ends
episodes.overview: As various conflicts draw to their conclusions, the Tendoshu swoop in to finish off the survivors.

episodes.name: Farewell, Buddy
episodes.overview: With the battle over, the survivors each go their separate ways. With Nobunobu appointed the new Shogun, Shigeshige and his retainers retreat to Kyo to regroup. For those left in Edo, there may be dark times ahead.

episodes.name: The Day the Demon Cried
episodes.overview: Following Shigeshige's assassination, the new Shogun, Nobunobu begins a purge of the old guard. Matsudaira and Kondo are blamed for failing to prevent the assassination and sentenced to be beheaded and the Shingengumi are disbanded. Lost and without a leader, they must now decide what to do next.

episodes.name: Heroes Always Arrive Fashionably Late
episodes.overview: Gin and Hijikata are drinking away their sorrows when Nobunobu and the Mimawarigumi storm the place. Nobunobu, not satisfied with having crushed Shigeshige and thei Shinsengumi attempts to antagonize Hijikata. Suddenly, an unexpected ally arrives.

episodes.name: Lost and Found
episodes.overview: Whilst Kondo And Katsura attempt to break out of prison, Hijikata must decide which path to walk.

episodes.name: Prison Break
episodes.overview: The Shinsengumi and Joi Rebels team up to rescue Kondo and Katsura from the prison island known as Kokujo, but things do not go to plan and they are soon ambushed by a familiar enemy.

episodes.name: Stray Dogs
episodes.overview: Odd Jobs and the Shinsengumi make land on the prison island, but to reach Kondo and Katsura they must content with the Tendoshu and the Mimawarigumi first.

episodes.name: Undelivered Mail
episodes.overview: Sasaki Isaburo's past with the Shinsengumi, Matsudaira, and Imai Nobume is finally revealed.

episodes.name: Karma
episodes.overview: Things come to a head on Kokujo Island, as death itself descends upon the battlefield.

episodes.name: Nobume
episodes.overview: With everyone fighting to regroup and escape, Sasaki makes the same mistake one more time.

episodes.name: Farewell Shinsengumi
episodes.overview: The complete fallout of the events at Kokujo Island come to light and brings about farewells nobody thought they'd ever see.

episodes.name: The Monster and the Monster's Child
episodes.overview: Katsura, his faction and the Yorozuya are in Akiba hiding from the bakufu before encountering Nobume, Matoko and Takechi.Thus weaves a tale of the Kiheitai's fall, the Tendoushuu's birth and a surprising secret of Shouyou.

episodes.name: Leave Letter
episodes.overview: As the Yorozuya struggle with the recent revelations, the Kiheitai find themselves with unexpected allies. Now all will go on a journey to the planet Rakuyou, once the birthplace of two certain redhead Yato.

episodes.name: The Song of a Samurai
episodes.overview: Enemies and allies have gathered on Rakuyou. So now the battles begin!

episodes.name: Zura
episodes.overview: Katsura, Sakamoto, and Gintoki must face off against the most dangerous members of the Harusame, the 3 Mad Stars. First up, it is Katsura vs Shoukaku, along with the reveal of Katsura's past.

episodes.name: The Two Fools
episodes.overview: One Star down, two to go; next up, it is Sakamoto vs Hankai. As he struggles to save ship and crew from the android's machinations, a certain character gains development.

episodes.name: Ten Years
episodes.overview: Two down, one to go; last up, Gintoki vs. Batou with mistaken identities and illusions galore. And in the end, a certain character awakens and a certain quartet reunite.

episodes.name: Path
episodes.overview: The Heavenly Kings are reunited to fight against the Harusame and Utsuro. Meanwhile, a certain father and son also reunite to kill the other; but not if Kagura have anything to say about it.

episodes.name: Master of Kouan
episodes.overview: Umibouzu vs. Utsuro and Kagura vs. Kamui. Though along the way, the father and son reveal the figure who has a connection to all four of them, the deceased wife and mother of three of them, Kouka.

episodes.name: The Lost Rabbit
episodes.overview: Through confusion and suffering, everything falls apart when Kouka grows ill and the ramifications of her constitution becomes apparent. In the present, Utsuro and Umibouzu's plus the siblings' fights end.

episodes.name: Siblings
episodes.overview: It is the Yorozuya and Abuto vs Kamui to save him from the brink.

episodes.name: First Student
episodes.overview: The arc comes to a close. Takasugi vs Oboro and Oboro's past is revealed.

episodes.name: Hope
episodes.overview: Utsuro's past is revealed as well as his ultimate plan, plus revelations are made. The Rakuyou Arc finale.

episodes.name: The Stairs to Adulthood May Not Always Lead Up
episodes.overview: Kagura has a boyfriend!! What unspeakable things will happen to him who appears before the obsessively nosey, restlessly agitated Umibozu and Gintoki!?

episodes.name: My Bald Dad, My Light-Haired Dad, and My Dad's Glasses
episodes.overview: Gintoki and Umibozu go all-out to stop Kagura's marriage from happening.

episodes.name: A Bowl of Ramen
episodes.overview: Katsura, upon hearing Ikumatsu's story about an old man who used to visit her restaurant every New Year's Eve, enlists the Odd Jobs' help to look for him.

episodes.name: A Family
episodes.overview: The gang discover the truth behind the old man and look to reunite him with Ikumatsu and her ramen.

episodes.name: Life, Death, and Shades / All the Answers Can Be Found in the Field
episodes.overview: Hasegawa has a life-or-death encounter with assassins, and the Shinsengumi and Mimawarigumi compete over solving a fictional case.

episodes.name: 3000 Leagues in Search of a Scabbard
episodes.overview: The Odd Jobs encounter a strange sword at Tetsuko's smithy, and it grows attached (quite literally) to Gintoki's behind!

episodes.name: The Super Sadist and the Super Sadist
episodes.overview: Kusanagi reveals the details of an old wound he received at the hands of the cursed sword, Maganagi, as Gintoki and Okita get ready for their duel. Meanwhile, Hijikata investigates Senbe the Manslayer.

episodes.name: The Strongest Sword, and the Dullest Ass
episodes.overview: The Excaliburling story reaches its climax as Maganagi takes over Okita's body and reveals the truth to Kusanagi. How will Gintoki respond?

episodes.name: Wash Your Hands Before a Handshake
episodes.overview: As group units take over the idol industry, Terakado Tsu must adapt or fall behind the times. But the idol she forms a combo unit with is... Kagura?

episodes.name: Diamonds are Unscratchable
episodes.overview: Boogie Diamonds 48 has to deal with the sudden arrival of Galaxy Kingdom Bitches 48, who challenge them for the spot of Edo's top idol!

episodes.name: An Idol's Badge of Honor
episodes.overview: The battle at the Oedo Dome heats up as the fans waver between the two groups, but Otsu is still holed up indoors. Will she fade away, or will Shinpachi and gang rekindle her passion?

episodes.name: The Line Between Godlike Games and Shitty Games is Paper-Thin
episodes.overview: In the first half, Gintoki decides that as protagonist, he can't sit and do nothing as a Gintama game is released. He takes matters into his own hands as Odd Jobs looks to produce a super hit. In the second, Shinpachi buys a new pair of glasses that get him rather high spirits...

episodes.name: Guardian Spirits Are Also a Part of the Soul
episodes.overview: The Kabuki District Sports Meet begins, and Shinpachi bears witness to the influence guardian spirits have on such events. Will he be able to fight through it and help Odd Jobs win the cash prize?

episodes.name: Try As You Might to Make a Natural Perm Go Away, It Will Always Return
episodes.overview: Utsuro's master plan is in full effect as Earth is taken over by the Altana Liberation Army. With Odd Jobs still not back from Rakuyo, the residents of Kabuki District have a hard time adjusting to life as a colony.

episodes.name: Flavoring is Best in Small Quantities
episodes.overview: Katsura, Sakamoto, and Nobunobu arrive at the S.S. Heavenly Bird and try to bring the Liberation Army to the negotiating table. Meanwhile, the various factions in Edo begin to make their move.

episodes.name: A Delinquent's Kid Has Long Neck Hair
episodes.overview: With the Odd Jobs looking for the Tendoshu, things heat up on the Liberation Army's main ship. Shijaku has promised his cooperation to Nobunobu, but now he must convince his comrades.

episodes.name: The Line Between Tenacious and Annoying Is Paper-Thin
episodes.overview: The encounter with Utsuro leaves Gintoki feeling more helpless than ever before. That's when he receives a very powerful reminder.

episodes.name: Geezers Carve the Things They Shouldn't Forget into Their Wrinkles
episodes.overview: The return of some familiar faces breathes new life into Earth's resistance, but they're as troublesome as they've always been! And when the Liberation Army brings out its big guns, it's up to Gengai to respond.

episodes.name: Machines That Pick Up Useless Habits Are Called People
episodes.overview: The machines have done their part and left Earth's future in the hands of humanity. But Gengai's cannon has also painted a huge target on the Kabuki Distruct, and the Liberation Army immediately marches toward it.

episodes.name: Men Must Live Not Long or Thick, but Hard
episodes.overview: Prince Hata's past is revealed along with the history of Planet Okoku. Can Katsura and Hasegawa really get them on Earth's side?

episodes.name: Ogres Are Weak Against Tiny Heroes Like the Inch-High Samurai
episodes.overview: The Kabuki District is under siege, and the fearsome Dakini race arrive on the scene. How can the District and its residents cope with this onslaught?

episodes.name: Bragging About Your Own Heroic Deeds Will Make People Hate You, So Make Others Do It For You
episodes.overview: The Shinra finally make their move and look to capture the creator of the virus cannon with their underhand tactics. But right as things get desperate, the "boss" of the Kabuki District intervenes

episodes.name: Jump and Power Creep Go Hand-in-Hand
episodes.overview: Under the leadership of the Kabuki District's Four Devas, the residents are beginning to drive out the enemies inside the town. However, they still have to deal with Ougai, the leader of the Dakini force.

episodes.name: Peace and Destruction Are Two Sides of the Same Coin
episodes.overview: After successfully driving the Liberation Army out of the Kabuki District, its residents enjoy a well-earned break. However, they know that the peace won't last for long.

episodes.name: Bushido Is Found One Second Before Death
episodes.overview: Gengai has gone missing, and Ensho has brought out his trump card. How can the Odd Jobs, the Shinsengumi, Katsura, Sakamoto, and Nobunobu get out of this desperate situation?

episodes.name: The Evildoers Who Do Good
episodes.overview: The other half of silver soul arc starts.

episodes.name: Rabbits Jump High on Moonlit Nights
episodes.overview: Kagura senses Yato presence and runs off to stop them, and she has some unexpected backup!

episodes.name: Making a Dull World Interesting
episodes.overview: With the Earth's Altana reserves going berserk, and the Flame of Kagutsuchi nearly ready to fire, the Kiheitai are left with hard choices to make in order to prevent the destruction of Earth and the entire galaxy.

episodes.name: Do something uncharacteristic, and something uncharacteristic will happen
episodes.overview: Ensho's past is revealed, and Takasugi revolves to make a final stand to take him down.

episodes.name: Countless Kings
episodes.overview: The story shifts back to Earth, where Utsuro has made the Altana ley lines go berserk. Some old, familiar faces rise up to combat it.

episodes.name: The Unemployed Cannot Be Stained By Anything
episodes.overview: Shijaku presents his brother, Prince Hata, with an impossible choice. As he finally makes his decision, Hasegawa suggests a different solution.

episodes.name: Always Hold On to Your Trump Cards
episodes.overview: As Sadaharu fights to quell the rampaging ley lines, the gang puts it all on the line to take down Utsuro.

episodes.name: The Creatures Known as Humanity
episodes.overview: The Odd Jobs are joined by old friends in their battle to save the Earth. Utsuro is surprised by a side of humanity he had never seen before.

episodes.name: Sign
episodes.overview: Two years have passed, and Gintoki has shut down the Odd Jobs business and gone off to do something only he can do. Shinpachi has other ideas, though.

episodes.name: Specter
episodes.overview: Shinpachi is forced into a plot to assassinate the inaugural prime minister of Japan, Donald Zuramp!

episodes.name: Two in Girl Years Is Equal to Ten in Man Years
episodes.overview: Okita and Kagura's daughter (?) rekindle their rivalry, and Okita senses something is off. Meanwhile, Gintoki runs into an old friend.

episodes.name: Salvation
episodes.overview: Gintoki and Takasugi reveal to each other what they've been doing over the past two years, and decide to go save the one thing they never managed to save in the past: their teacher.

episodes.name: Dun Dun
episodes.overview: Now back in Edo, Gintoki doesn't know how to face his old friends, and so he decides to try and avoid running into any of them. However, that won't be easy.

episodes.name: There Are Lines Even Villains Can't Cross
episodes.overview: Having caught Takasugi Shinsfake, the ladies' gang decides to teach him a lesson and try and get him to spill the beans on where Gintoki is. How will Shinsfake survive this?

11.name: Gintama. - Silver Soul Arc 2
11.overview: Second Season of the final arc of Gintama.
